content:
In the OrganizationAffiliation which out of the below data elements provided in the resource does the diagram organization points?
http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-pdex-plan-net/StructureDefinition-plannet-OrganizationAffiliation.html
Since there are three Organization on the diagram but only 2 organization reference on the FHIR resource

Screenshot-2021-04-05-at-9.31.53-PM.png
Hi @Chetana Nayyar - Plan-Net Organization Affiliation references two organizations: participatingOrganization and organization. The PartOf is simply a reference from any organizaiton.

Saul Kravitz said:

Hi Chetana Nayyar - Plan-Net Organization Affiliation references two organizations: participatingOrganization and organization. The PartOf is simply a reference from any organizaiton.

If we see in the diagram there are 3 Organization , that is where I am pointing; that the FHIR resource for OrganizationAffiliation just talks about 2 Organization Screenshot-2021-04-05-at-10.48.42-PM.png

Hi @Chetana Nayyar -- where were you during the ballot reconciliation?. We would have benefited from your sharp eye.
Now I see what you are referencing.... looks like a stray arrow in the diagram ;-)
Thanks for clarifying @Saul Kravitz this was really helpful.

Is this better?
image.png
@Chetana Nayyar

There is one challenge with this since OrganizationAffiliation as well as the PractitonerRole points to the same Organization block. This gives an impression that the organization to which a practitioner is associated even the participating organization is associated with the same Organization. Is that even a possible scenario ?
@Saul Kravitz

@Chetana Nayyar
This drawing is showing relationships of PROFILES, not INSTANCES.
The number of times I repeated Organization is simply to make the relationships drawable.
It this more compact representation clouds that issue, I can go back to the previous form, and simple delete the edge that you noticed as a stray.

Is this better?

Will you update the PlanNet home page with this diagram to avoid confusion?
